item.description:
Providence Latin American Film Festival

Perro Come Perro // Dog Eat Dog

From the PLAFF Web Site:

Carlos Moreno, Colombia, color, 35mm, 2008, 104’

Sundance Goes South American With Carlos Moreno’s PERRO COME PERRO, a film revolving around two corrupt ex-cops now hired killers at the service of an underground collecting office in Cali. Betrayal, revenge, and the drug trade with a bit of South American witchcraft thrown in for good measure.

Carlos Moreno. Film Director, Musician and Social Communicator, with a Master’s Degree in Audiovisual Narrative. Carlos has wide experience as a film director and editing documentaries, creative and experimental videos, advertising pieces, video clips, and short films, in Colombia as well as in Central America. Dog eat Dog is his first feature film. He co-directed with Gerardo Muyshondt the documentary UNO: la historia de un gol (One: the story of a goal). He also developed, as director and co–scriptwriter, the short film Caja Negra (Black Box), and directed the Telemovie Sin Retorno (Without return), for Fox Telecolombia. He lives and works in Bogotá.

More information about PLAFF can be found here: http://www.plaff.org...
item.how_to_find_us: Please meet in the main lobby by 8:15pm so we can find seats together.
item.name: PLAFF // Perro Come Perro // Dog Eat Dog
